text: The bill 's leading advocate , Sen. Elizabeth Warren , D - Mass . , and other Congressional Democrats joined Obama for the announcement .Sen. Bernie Sanders , I - Vt . , told NECN he wholeheartedly supports a debtor 's ability to refinance their student loans and make the costs more manageable .He said lessening the interest payments would allow borrowers to spend their resources elsewhere , thus strengthening the middle class ." We have just a terrible crisis , " Sanders said , describing the level of student loan debt in the United States , which he said could easily turn families off of sending their children to college . " As a nation , if we want to compete in the global economy , we need the best - educated workforce in the world .We need to encourage people to get that education , not discourage them ."Sanders said he regularly hears stories from constituents with undergraduate degrees carrying $ 25 - 60,000 in debt , and ones with graduate degrees carrying twice that amount or more .However , Sanders acknowledged passing the refinancing legislation will be a tough fight , with Senate Republicans raising concerns over the cost to the government and over how that same legislation proposes new taxes on some high - income taxpayers .Shortly before President Obama signed the executive memorandum , Secretary of Education Arne Duncan told reporters the initiative 's price tag has not been determined ." We actually do n't know the costs yet , " Duncan said ." We 'll figure that out on the back end ." The AP reported Republican leaders in Congress have faulted Obama 's steps on loan repayments for failing to address the root cause of crippling debt loads : college costs that are too high .As a separate push from the refinancing legislation , Sen. Sanders has another proposal to bring down college costs .Sanders would like to expand programs that allow high school juniors and seniors to take college - level classes and earn credit that counts toward both high school and college graduation .His office explained in a news release that the approach reduces the cost and time necessary to complete a college degree .The bill is co - sponsored by several senators including Sen. Patrick Leahy , D - Vt . , Sen. Chris Murphy , D - Conn , and Sen. Jack Reed , D - R.I. , Sanders ' staff noted .As for recent grad Nathan Bacon , he told NECN he hopes his mechanical engineering degree helps him convert a paid internship into a full - time job at a Vermont manufacturer of cables for industrial , automotive , commercial vehicle , and military customers .Bacon said he 'll need to work hard to earn cash to afford to live and make those student loan payments for years to come ." Unless I win the lottery , " he chuckled ." That 'd be cool ! "Nearly 19 percent of people with student loans owe more than $ 50,000 , according to a report from the Federal Reserve , and that number is expected to rise .

U.S. Senator Bernie Sanders will travel to Colorado on Saturday to hold a rally at the Colorado Convention Center in Denver .Sanders plans to discuss his ideology which includes money in politics , climate change and college affordability .Doors open at 3 p.m.The event will start at 5 p.m. and is free and open to the public .Vermont Sen. Bernie Sanders released an online video Thursday featuring the daughter of Eric Garner , a 43-year - old unarmed father of six who was killed in a chokehold by New York City police officers in 2014 .The video is an example of attempts by the Democratic presidential candidate to reach out to black voters as the race heads to South Carolina and Nevada , where there are large populations of blacks and Latinos .In South Carolina , black voters make up more than 60 % of the primary electorate .People are dying .This is real .This is not TV ." I think we need to believe in a leader like Bernie Sanders .People are dying .This is real .We need a president that will talk about it .Bernie is a protester .He 's not scared to go up against the criminal justice system .He is not scared ." - Erica Garner .Harry Belafonte has endorsed Bernie Sanders .Jane Sanders , the wife of Sen. Bernie Sanders ( I - VT ) , on Wednesday said she found former Secretary of State Madeleine Albright 's comments urging female voters to support Hillary Clinton " disturbing . "" I found them unfortunate and disturbing , " Jane Sanders told HuffPost Live about Albright 's comments .By that case , then , if Bernie won the Democratic nomination and Carly Fiorina won the Republican nomination , we should be supporting Carly Fiorina . "( snip ) " She apologized .( Steinem )I know that young people were offended by it , but it was a mistake , " Jane Sanders said on Wednesday ." That 's what I do n't like about politics too much , that somebody makes a misstatement .We know her life has been about equity for women and feminism .She made a mistake , she said so .I absolutely still respect her very much ." Pay Fail Democratic presidential candidate Bernie Sanders pays his campaign interns , but most ( if not all ) of the other major presidential candidates do not .CLAIM : Bernie Sanders is one of the few 2016 presidential candidates ( if not the only one ) to pay his campaign interns .True .( snip )First , the candidates offering unpaid internships are not breaking any laws .In most cases , it is perfectly legal to hire interns for non - paying positions as long as those interns receive some tangible benefit ( such as school credit or valuable work experience ) in return .Second , some candidates , such as Republican Ben Carson , do offer their interns others forms of compensation , such as stipends for food or travel .

A recent posting on Bernie Sanders ' web site , on the other hand , advertises a paid internship position ( although such ads do not necessarily indicate that all campaign internship positions are paying ones ) : .Bernie Sanders has won the Democratic presidential primary in New Hampshire .CBS News , CNN and The Associated Press called the race at about 8 p.m. , just after the polls closed .At about 9:30 p.m. , Sanders declared victory in a speech before an elated crowd of supporters at his watch party in Concord ." Thank you , New Hampshire ! "Sanders said to cheers ." Together we have sent a message that will echo from Wall Street to Washington , from Maine to California .And that is that the government of our country belongs to all of the people , and not just a handful of wealthy campaign contributors and their super PACs . "Senator Bernie Sanders beat Hillary Clinton among nearly every demographic group in the Democratic New Hampshire primary , according to exit polls .He carried majorities of both men and women .He won among those with and without college degrees .He won among gun owners and non - gun owners .He beat Mrs. Clinton among previous primary voters and those participating for the first time .And he ran ahead among both moderates and liberals .Even so , there were a few silver linings for Mrs. Clinton .While Mr. Sanders bested her among all age groups younger than 45 , the two candidates polled evenly among voters aged 45 to 64 .And Mrs. Clinton won the support of voters 65 and older .And , though Mrs. Clinton lost nearly every income group , she did carry voters in families earning over $ 200,000 per year .An Algerian man casts his vote at a polling station in Algiers during local elections on November 29 , 2012 .Algeria 's ruling party is eyeing a landslide victory in local elections , with numerous opposition groups warning of fraud in a poll that could struggle to mobilise a disaffected electorate .AFP PHOTO / FAROUK BATICHE Show more .Democratic presidential candidate Sen. Show more .Suchbegriffe .Algeria 's ruling party is eyeing a landslide victory in local elections , with numerous opposition groups warning of fraud in a poll that could struggle to mobilise a disaffected electorate .AFP PHOTO / FAROUK BATICHE ( Photo credit should read FAROUK BATICHE / AFP / Getty Images ) .Dieses Bild einbetten .Durch Verwenden des unten angegebenen Codes und das Einbetten dieses Bildes erklären Sie sich mit den Nutzungsbedingungen von Getty Images einverstanden .Hinweis : Eingebettete Bilder dürfen nicht für kommerzielle Zwecke verwendet werden .Leider ist ein Fehler aufgetreten .Schließen Sie dieses Fenster , um es erneut zu versuchen .Sen. Bernie Sanders , I - Vt , says he 'll continue pushing for additional relief for indebted Americans .Monday , President Obama signed a memorandum that will expand an existing program allowing borrowers to spend no more than 10 percent of their monthly income on student loan payments .The White House said the move could provide relief for around 5-million Americans with student loan debt .Nearly 19 percent of people with student loans owe more than $ 50,000 , according to a report from the Federal Reserve , and that number is expected to rise .Take a look at which states ' residents have the most and least student debt ." Americans now owe more on student loans than they do on credit cards , " Obama said of the more than $ 1-trillion debt load for student loans in this country . "And the outrage here is that they 're just doing what they 've been told they 're supposed to do . "Nathan Bacon , who told New England Cable News he recently graduated from Norwich University in the central Vermont town of Northfield , said later this year , he 'll start paying off nearly $ 40,000 in student loan debt ." I 'm signing away my life for the next , like , 15 - 20 years , " Bacon said ." People are profiting off of the fact I went to school ." Expecting to pay $ 200 or more a month in student loan payments , Bacon said he worries about making ends meet with other costs , like rent , utilities , and food ." I drive an old car , so any time I have to make a repair-- if it 's a $ 500 repair-- that 's something that 's going to put me on thin ice through my next paycheck , " Bacon added .Obama also announced he is directing the government to renegotiate contracts with federal student loan servicers to encourage them to make it easier for borrowers to avoid defaulting on their loans , the Associated Press wrote .He asked the Treasury and Education departments to work with major tax preparers , including H&R Block and the makers of TurboTax , to increase awareness about tuition tax credits and flexible repayment options available to borrowers ." It 's going to make progress , but not enough , " Obama said ." We need more .
